StringTable.Label: AcidWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Acid World

StringTable.Label: AcidWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Acid Worlds are rich in common minerals, with heavy deposits of formic, hydrochloric, hydrocyanic, nitric, phosphoric, and sulfuric acids.

StringTable.Label: AlkaliWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Alkali World

StringTable.Label: AlkaliWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Alkali Worlds are rich in alkali base metals, with medium deposits of strontium, barium, and calcium. They appear green from space, with blotches of teal and blue on the surface.

StringTable.Label: AuricWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Auric World

StringTable.Label: AuricWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Auric Worlds have the equivalent of three huge deposits of gold available for collection on them. They appear yellow from space.

StringTable.Label: AzureWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Azure World

StringTable.Label: AzureWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Azure Worlds feature light deposits of indium, vanadium, and molybdenum.

StringTable.Label: CarbideWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Carbide World

StringTable.Label: CarbideWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Carbide Worlds are rich in carbon, a common element, with three heavy deposits' worth.

StringTable.Label: ChlorineWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Chlorine World

StringTable.Label: ChlorineWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Chlorine Worlds feature very heavy deposits of both pure chlorine and hydrochloric acids, with light deposits of zinc and trace deposits of gallium.

StringTable.Label: ChondriteWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Chondrite World

StringTable.Label: ChondriteWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Chondrite Worlds feature heavy deposits of ethanol and free radicals.

StringTable.Label: CimmerianWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Cimmerian World

StringTable.Label: CimmerianWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Cimmerian Worlds have midsize deposits of methane, ammonia, methanol, and lithium.

StringTable.Label: CopperWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Copper World

StringTable.Label: CopperWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Copper Worlds are made of pure copper, and feature the equivalent of two huge deposits of copper.

StringTable.Label: CrimsonWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Crimson World

StringTable.Label: CrimsonWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Crimson Worlds feature light deposits of barium, boron, beryllium, bismuth, and bromine.

StringTable.Label: CyanicWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Cyanic World

StringTable.Label: CyanicWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Cyanic Worlds usually have huge quantities of Cyano-acetylene.

StringTable.Label: DustWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Dust World

StringTable.Label: DustWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: [ICON=DesertWorldIcon] Dust Worlds have light deposits of bismuth, aluminum, and potassium. Their surface is composed of silicate and metal oxides. Their thin atmosphere occasionally supports minimal ecosystems.

StringTable.Label: EmeraldWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Emerald World

StringTable.Label: EmeraldWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Emerald Worlds are rich in exotic minerals, with medium deposits of antimatter and huge deposits of Aguuti nodules.

StringTable.Label: FluorescentWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Fluorescent World

StringTable.Label: FluorescentWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Fluorescent Worlds have huge quantities of technetium and neon, and light quantities of radon.

StringTable.Label: GasGiantWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Gas Giant World

StringTable.Label: GasGiantWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Gas Giants get their name from the fact that they are incredibly large planets composed of gases. They often have many moons.

StringTable.Label: GreenWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Green World

StringTable.Label: GreenWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Green Worlds have heavy deposits of praseodymium and neodymium.

StringTable.Label: HalideWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Halide World

StringTable.Label: HalideWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Halide Worlds feature medium deposits of the corrosive halide elements bromine, fluorine, and iodine, and the radioactive halide astatine.

StringTable.Label: HydrocarbonWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Hydrocarbon World

StringTable.Label: HydrocarbonWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Hydrocarbon Worlds are planets with huge deposits of hydrocarbons and have light quantaties of the base metal tantalum and trace amounts of bismuth.

StringTable.Label: InfraredWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Infrared World

StringTable.Label: InfraredWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Infrared Worlds feature large deposits of mercury.

StringTable.Label: IodineWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Iodine World

StringTable.Label: IodineWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Iodine Worlds feature some base metals and corrosive elements, especially Iodine.

StringTable.Label: LanthanideWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Lanthanide World

StringTable.Label: LanthanideWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Lanthanide Worlds are worlds composed of the heavy rare earth elements. They are rich in elements like ytterbium, cerium, and lanthanum.

StringTable.Label: MagmaWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Magma World

StringTable.Label: MagmaWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: [ICON=Active_Core_Icon] Magma Worlds are worlds with a very thin crust, and experience extremely frequent earthquakes as a result of the motion of the mantle.

StringTable.Label: MagneticWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Magnetic World

StringTable.Label: MagneticWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Magnetic Worlds have ferromagnetic metals, especially nickel and niobium, and a small amount of exotic magnetic monopoles. Their strong magnetic fields cause the manifestation of vicious lightning storms.

StringTable.Label: MaroonWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Maroon World

StringTable.Label: MaroonWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Maroon Worlds have base metals and common minerals.

StringTable.Label: MetalWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Metal World

StringTable.Label: MetalWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Metal Worlds or Metallic Worlds are rich in all sorts of metals, including precious metals, corrosives, and base metals.

StringTable.Label: NobleWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Noble World

StringTable.Label: NobleWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Noble Worlds are rich in noble gases, sometimes also having small deposits of common Helium.

StringTable.Label: OoliteWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Oolite World

StringTable.Label: OoliteWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Oolite Worlds have moderate deposits of rare earth metals as well as small levels of precious metals.

StringTable.Label: OpalescentWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Opalescent World

StringTable.Label: OpalescentWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Opalescent Worlds feature rare earth metals, noble gases, and base metals.

StringTable.Label: OrganicWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Organic World

StringTable.Label: OrganicWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Organic Worlds feature organic compounds, common minerals like carbon dioxide, formaldehyde, and free radicals.

StringTable.Label: PellucidWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Pellucid World

StringTable.Label: PellucidWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Pellucid Worlds are less opaque than most, and usually have very small amounts of exotic minerals, typically Tzo Crystals, if any minerals at all.

StringTable.Label: PlutonicWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Plutonic World

StringTable.Label: PlutonicWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Plutonic Worlds are geologically active, but have little volcanism. Therefore, most rocks there formed deep beneath the crust, and frequently contain large deposits of base, rare earth, and radioactive metals.

StringTable.Label: PrimordialWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Primordial World

StringTable.Label: PrimordialWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Primordial Worlds have common minerals and base metals. These planets are large and rocky, composed of a core of metal and a crust of silicate. Their atmosphere is composed of a super-thick layer of carbon dioxide at extremely hot temperatures.

StringTable.Label: PurpleWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Purple World

StringTable.Label: PurpleWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Purple Worlds have some base metals.

StringTable.Label: QuasiDegenerateWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Quasi-Degenerate World

StringTable.Label: QuasiDegenerateWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Quasi-Degenerate Worlds often have some exotic Degenerate Matter.

StringTable.Label: RadioactiveWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Radioactive World

StringTable.Label: RadioactiveWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Radioactive Worlds possess good deals of radioactive minerals. The radioactive substances are either the result of an atypical gas composition of the atmosphere or unusual mantle convection processes.

StringTable.Label: RainbowWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Rainbow World

StringTable.Label: RainbowWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: [ICON=GhostWorldIcon] Rainbow Worlds are "worlds whose radiant energies defy all scanners producing a rainbow-like image".

StringTable.Label: ReduxWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Redux World

StringTable.Label: ReduxWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Redux Worlds or Reduction Worlds have base metals and corrosive minerals like Oxygen, Chlorine, and Sulfur. The atmosphere of these planets consists of methane and ammonia rather than oxygen.

StringTable.Label: RubyWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Ruby World

StringTable.Label: RubyWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Ruby Worlds are a very rare type of planet, covered with the coveted exotic minerals, especially Neutronium and Tzo Crystals. Two prominent Ruby Worlds have a hellish surface temperature and lack an atmosphere.

StringTable.Label: SapphireWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Sapphire World

StringTable.Label: SapphireWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Sapphire Worlds are rich in exotic minerals, such as Super Fluids and Reisburg Helices.

StringTable.Label: SelenicWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Selenic World

StringTable.Label: SelenicWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Selenic Worlds are similar in most respects to our moon, and feature base metals like Selenium, Calcium, and Aluminum.

StringTable.Label: ShatteredWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Shattered World

StringTable.Label: ShatteredWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Shattered are former Water or Telluric Worlds that had their crusts shattered by the Mycon Deep Children. They usually have very large quantities of base metals, precious and radioactive minerals, but also have very hostile tectonic conditions.

StringTable.Label: SuperDenseWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Super-Dense World

StringTable.Label: SuperDenseWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Super-Dense Worlds, as their name implies, feature very dense base metals such as Lead. Their high density causes seismic instability and heavy gravity, making them dangerous and expensive to land on.

StringTable.Label: TelluricWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Telluric World

StringTable.Label: TelluricWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Telluric Worlds have precious and base metals.

StringTable.Label: TreasureWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Treasure World

StringTable.Label: TreasureWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Treasure Worlds are rich in precious minerals like Gold and Silver.

StringTable.Label: UltramarineWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Ultramarine World

StringTable.Label: UltramarineWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Ultramarine Worlds are rich in rare earth minerals like Holmium, and sometimes feature life.

StringTable.Label: UltravioletWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Ultraviolet World

StringTable.Label: UltravioletWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Ultraviolet Worlds have high concentrations of precious metals, moderate levels of corrosives and common elements, and trace amounts of base metals.

StringTable.Label: UreaWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Urea World

StringTable.Label: UreaWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Urea Worlds have some common minerals like Ammonia, and can support life.

StringTable.Label: VinylogousWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Vinylogous World

StringTable.Label: VinylogousWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Vinylogous Worlds have base metals and common minerals.

StringTable.Label: WaterWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Water World

StringTable.Label: WaterWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Water Worlds are planetary bodies in which the majority of the surface is covered in water (or ice or vapours).

StringTable.Label: XenolithicWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Xenolithic World

StringTable.Label: XenolithicWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Xenolithic Worlds have scattered deposits of precious metals with trace amounts of base metals.

StringTable.Label: YttricWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Yttric World

StringTable.Label: YttricWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: Yttric Worlds are worlds composed of Yttrium and Ytterbium. They hold rare earth metals and base metals.

StringTable.Label: EvilOnesWaterWorldSC_Name
StringTable.String: Evil Ones World

StringTable.Label: EvilOnesWaterWorldSC_Dec
StringTable.String: This Water World has inhabitants that the Spathi call the 'Evil Ones'.
